website_summaries.verdict: Unlike some other cleats, once you strap these on, they stay put. The price is great as well.
pros: 10 metal studs offer optimal stability and traction
Easy to get on and off
When they're on, they stay on
cons: Order up a size to get a good fit
Some buyers say that the metal studs and straps are not high-quality

customer_reviews.title: Sizing: foot vs shoe
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you have right size for the shoe you are putting them on. I wear woman's 8 shoe. If you are use on a running a shoe. Purchase size med. If using on a snow moon boot, purchase large. If using on a sorel purchase an extra large. Sizing does not depend on your shoe size... It's the thickness on the outside of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Downie

customer_reviews.title: I thought it wouldn't be so bad, so I continued to attempt to put it ...
customer_reviews.text: They say you get what you pay for. But I didn't even get that. The rubber stretchy material is extremely cheap and broke as soon as I attempted to put it on my boot. I thought it wouldn't be so bad, so I continued to attempt to put it on my boot, and it ripped AGAIN. Yes, it was cold outside and the rubber was cold, but these are made for ice and snow (allegedly). I actually consider myself lucky that it ripped while I was trying to put it on my boot, as if it ripped while I was hiking on ice, serious injury could have resulted. These are junk and I would highly recommend any other option.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: The Cleats are prone to extremely rapid wear
customer_reviews.text: These grips were worn seven or eight times last week to assist me with snow blowing during our storm. Each time they were on the snow and ice for a half hour at most. The cleats on the heels are entirely gone - worn flat. The cleats on the ball of the foot are more than half gone. I am not normally one to register complaints regarding a product but I have chosen to make an exception here. This is a disappointing product; no, it is an inferior product but marketed as a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry VanSpronsen

customer_reviews.title: Easy on/off life savers.
customer_reviews.text: If you live in the frozen North you should not be allowed to buy Health or Life insurance if you don't own these! Super grip and light enough to not notice wearing them and easy to carry in a jacket pocket between uses. We stash them in every vehicle and at every exit door. Often we just leave them on a pair of slip on shoes outside the door. DON'T WEAR THEM INDOORS ON WOOD FLOORS, LINOLEUM OR TILE FLOORS!!!
customer_reviews.author: GMP

customer_reviews.title: The BEST investment that I have made in a long time!!
customer_reviews.text: The BEST investment that I have made in a long time!! I broke my leg last year on snow/ice, right outside my door. If not a life saver these will definately be a limb saver for me. I live in the NW Washington mountains and have used them on icy snowy porch steps, driveway & trails. They do exactly what they're supposed to do!! I agree with other reviews that you should go up a size for the right fit. I wear a size 6.5 shoe & bought a size medium & I'm glad I did. Thanks so much Limm!!
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Best cletes for shoes or boots I've used.
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT. Easy to get on & off. I don't slip on ice anymore. I like the fact I can wear them on shoes or boots drive with them on it car, walk on a ice covered parking lot at stores when I get inside they slip off real easy. put in pocket. When ready to go back out to car sit down on seat & put them back on & have a safe trip to car where ice is between cars & stops me from falling. The long tab in back is what makes them so easy to get on. Shipment came fast Will order more soon
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Marcinko

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: I like that these traction cleats did not get hung up on the carpet and they were safer when making a transition from indoors to outdoors. Visa Versa. They did not slip or slide on the floor. They are flat and easily stored in a pocket. The picture online is confusing. They run big and did not stay centered on sneakers. Would have been the right size for a boot though. (An XL for a size 12 / 43 boot. L. for an 11-12 sneaker They work best when the ice is not thick. The color black looks obvious ugly on sneakers. Did not walk with confidence using them.
customer_reviews.author: dancinflangeezs

customer_reviews.title: Great cleats for doing snow shoveling/snow blowing especially if there is a thin layer of ice under the snow.
customer_reviews.text: These cleats make it much safer doing snow shoveling/snow blowing especially if there is a thin layer of ice under the snow. However, I must say that they will not prevent slipping if walking on thick ice (1/2 inch or thicker). But for normal conditions they are really good. One should note that if you have "thicker" winter boots, you should order one size larger than the sizing indicates. The seller was absolutely great at correcting the sizing problem.
customer_reviews.author: The Skipper

customer_reviews.title: good enough but won't last all season here in Wisconsin
customer_reviews.text: These run small. I ordered size medium and had to re-order a large to fit my boots. I can use the mediums for my shoes, if I ever need to. The spikes wear out quickly. I've shoveled snow three or four times already and some of the spikes are worn down to the plastic. I'm glad the order includes a package of extra spikes. They are easy to install. That said, they are also easily dislodged. I've lost several already. The rubber is strong and the fit snug. This product will keep you from slipping on ice. I'm not a huge 5-star fan but I'm a fan and would re-order if I couldn't find a better product elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Mae

customer_reviews.title: Used these in Iceland
customer_reviews.text: We used these on our recent trip to Iceland. They were perfect. We walked on a lot of ice and felt very safe. Went up and down a lot of icy steps, no issues. They were easy to get on and off. We had ours on while others were still struggling with theirs that were a different brand. They are NOT meant to be worn inside. Now I cannot say how they would be on a ten mile hike but for 12 bucks they were perfect for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ross

customer_reviews.title: I tried to use them for a winter obstacle course ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use them for a winter obstacle course race. This turned out to be a plus/minus experience. The treads did provide more confidence on snow & some traction on ice. However, my first one disappeared in some mud. Soon, the second disappeared into the mud as well. Overall, they provided some extra traction on semi-slippery surfaces. However they didn't stick on my shoes with some adversity. Difficult to done too hard on them since they weren't advertised a mud tread.
customer_reviews.author: a. d. walker

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after falling last year and breaking my leg. I used them onlyfor clearing snow from my sidewalk and porch. The main cleats that are the ones that touch the ground the most are smooth or almost smooth so they didn’t last long but I paid about 5 dollars each so for that amount they are easily replaced. But if you do heavy duty hiking or walking these aren’t for you.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Mc

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: I live in downstate NY, and so far we really haven't had the kind of weather that would demand I use these. But, the other morning I did awake to find treacherous conditions, so I put them on. I loved how easy it was to do that. I was surprised those seemingly little cleats kept me from slipping on either snow or ice. I now don't have to worry about snapping the metal coils that use to cover the soles of my shoes, and if I have to tread on the floor to get to the door, I don't have to worry so much.
customer_reviews.author: SueC

customer_reviews.title: I think they are going to work very well
customer_reviews.text: I just received these a few days ago. I've used them once on icy sidewalks. My sister was walking with me with NO ice cleats on and she even commented on how I was not slipping around at all. While I can't really speak to their durability, since I just got them, they seem to be very well made and I'm hoping they will last this winter and next. As I said, they seem to be very well made.
customer_reviews.author: tao-kitty

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: With the winter we have had this year, these have been an absolute life saver. They slipped on my boots easily and have prevented me from falling so far!! Our back walk way is literally an ice path and I walk it several times a day. My falls (one down the porch stairs, one on the walkway) were the reason I purchased these and they have not disappointed. I drive with them on too without any issue. They slip off easily enough too if need be. They are well worth the money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: spookmama

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these before I knew that my job would provide a set for me. However, those fit well on the old winter boots that I wear for work(I work outside) and these fit well on my new winter boots that I wear at home. I wear a nine wide and they fit perfectly. These also have ten cleats, as opposed to the ones provided by work which only have six. Also, I attempted to cancel my order when I learned my employer would provide them but they had already shipped. In that time, Limm kept up a constant chain of communication so even though it was too late to cancel, they were very responsive, which I appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Ice? Get these and save your body from harm
customer_reviews.text: Last winter I fell three times on ice, never expecting to of course. I swore that before I did any permanent damage to my body I would never venture out in uncertain conditions without cleats of some kind. I bought Yak Tracks and these and both styles work great. I had to go to the chiropractor after my falls last winter for the jarring my body suffered. Much as I like her, I would rather not have to make any more of those kinds of visits and I absolutely don't want to sustain any worse damage. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PAH

customer_reviews.title: Work great - good value
customer_reviews.text: I live in an icey world all winter and just got these. They allow me to run after my very badly behaved dog when the roads are slick and I have great traction. They are soft rubber so very easy to get on and off. I had the coil kind but those were just weird to walk in. I had the very heavy-duty rubber ones that look bomber but are tough to get on and off the boot. Took one star off for having put one on backwards and having it fall off... combo of user error and slightly confusing design
customer_reviews.author: Ginny's Store

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! GREAT product- Hokkaido proven!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my recent trip to Hokkaido, to see the snow festivals (Sapporo and Asahikawa), and to see the endangered cranes in Kushiro. I usually don’t write reviews, but I was so impressed with these ice cleats. These are so easy to put on and take off, strong, stay put on boots or shoes and I could walk normally and even jog, on snow and ice covered walks and trails. I saw several people slip and fall at the festivals, and I had completely sure footing. What a great product! I highly recommend these ice cleats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steady traction on slick, hard-packed snow, and ice
customer_reviews.text: 4 instead of 5 as these cleats are new, and I don't know how well it will hold up. I ordered a M for a size 8 Merrill womens outdoor shoe, and it was a correct fit. Be careful to stretch the item so that the cleats are positioned over the balls of the shoe, and over the heels. Without careful stretching and positioning the cleat area will be in the arch of the shoe. The cleats are easy to get on a shoe or a boot.
customer_reviews.author: PlumBlossom

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a medium per guidelines ( I am an 8 womens) and the treads to not hit the shoe properly - see photo. The back treads should be closer to the heal, as shown in the advertisement. Everything else seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in Every Way
customer_reviews.text: These cleats do exaclty what they advertise. They grip well in icy and snowy conditions which gives some peace of mind for those who live where snow and ice present walking hazards. And they are lightweight, durable, and easy to fold up and put away when not in use. Over time, the elasticized rubber holds up well-- the only reason to replace them is when the cleats wear down. My husband usually gets one to one and half winters out of one pair.
customer_reviews.author: doublezd

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: I am accident prone and have broken several bones in the last few years slipping and falling so I was looking for something to help with that. We had a couple of very icy storms right after I got these and I was able to clear my driveway without fear of falling and walk across my parking lot at work safely. They are easy to get on and off and you should not wear them inside as they can damage your floors. But outside they are great!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for ice!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these for gifts and got one for myself. My dog walking was effortless in the snow and ice. I thought they might interfere with my gait, but not a bit. My friends were delighted to receive them so they could walk in parking lots without fear of falling. I had to remove them when I walked into a store with smooth floors though. They were quite slippery there, but slipped off easily
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Last year took two hard falls, once badly to my head on the ice and ever since am such a chicken when it snows and freezes and now being pregnant I knew I needed to try something. These are perfect. Easy to just throw in my purse when I know it’s gonna snow while at work so I can slip on my boots before I walk to my car, etc! I wear a size 8 in these sperrys and these fit them perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Even better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I got these mainly for working on icy & snow covered roofs because they don't damage the shingles as much. They work great, stay on without slipping, and are easy to put on & take off. I also take them with on hiking trips for companions that don't have spikes and they work very good. Even better than spikes if you're traveling over a mixture of rock & ice.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Rubber quickly stretches with use. Does not stay on after two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of snow and ice/freezing rain in the midwest this year. I broke down and bought these cleats which worked great, at first. After only a couple uses, the rubber has stretched out and no longer stays on my boots. They come off every 50-100 steps. When it's well below zero it is very inconvenient to take off your gloves to fix or adjust the cleats. They work well when they stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Allen

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my husband and myself and they have worked well for both of us. My husband wasn't sure how easily they would fit but after using them a few times he was pleased with how they fit and work. Mine went on easily and I really like them as well as how compact they are for storing. I'm glad we got them and they will get good use, I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Mom

customer_reviews.title: One of the cleats came out
customer_reviews.text: These are shown on shoe type appearl, we wanted them for snowmobile boots. I ordered the xtra large and after a lot os stretching we were able to get them on a mens size 10 snowmobile boot. Unfortunately one fell off on his first trip out into the snow and we will have to wait until spring to find that one. I did order another set as they are cheap enough to give it a second try.
customer_reviews.author: harrietjane22

customer_reviews.title: Walking on ice with no fear
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the compact crampons for a in Utah. A quick stop in Bryce saw snow and ice. We used them for stability while walking the icy Navajo trail at sunset point. Other people were holding onto the rails for dear life as then descended sliding and holding on. We slipped these on and just walked right on down. Of course we walked closer to the rail just in case. Overall I recommend the compact crampons for light duty walking.
customer_reviews.author: Goober McGoob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I just received these & there is currently no ice or snow to try them out. I originally ordered a size M, which was what was recommended for my shoe size. They fit securely, but the heel cleats were not on my heel, but more toward the ball of my foot. I received an email from the seller & I relayed this information. They immediately shipped a size L for me to try. Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: hrgds

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought these years ago! Walking dogs in the winter can be treacherous but now I have no fear of falling when I wear these cleats. They are of very good quality, easy to put on your boots and remove. I don't go out walking without them anymore. Would buy another pair and probably will when the cleats wear down. So far they are lasting!
customer_reviews.author: Beachbound

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller boots...
customer_reviews.text: I live in Arctic, Bush, Alaska and am walking on snow/ice for a big part of the year. These slip on traction cleats seem durable and do grip on glare ice well, but don't want to stay on my size 13 Baffin Ice Bear boots. I have to tie them on or else after about 50 paces they work their way off. A lower profile/smaller size boot should work better. I did get the XL size, but still too small for my big boots.
customer_reviews.author: skyskifoxman

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and multi use.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for extra traction while jetty fishing South Padre island, TX. They are easy to put on and stay over my shoes all day no problem. They bite into the seaweed that grows on the rocks and really help keep from slipping. I will buy these again because the saltwater does eventually corrode them after a couple dozen uses.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality and even poorer fit.
customer_reviews.text: I've worn ice cleats forever. The brand I always bought would last five years or mores. Unfortunately I could not find my favorite brand this year and bought these. Not only was the quality poor but the fit was too small. I wish I could find my old brand but they don't seem to be around anymore.
customer_reviews.author: E Foster

customer_reviews.title: Did not last through first use
customer_reviews.text: Cleats are easy to slip over most boots, and appear to give good traction. However, the rubber connection strap broke on mine within the first 5 minutes of use. I ordered the product 1 year ago in case of snow, but did not have an occasion to use until today. The cleats had been still sealed in their packaging, but the strap broke upon the first use. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Everett

customer_reviews.title: they really work!!!:)
customer_reviews.text: In the Beartooth mountains of Montana, on slippery ice going uphill or down they provide reliable grip. The only downside is getting them mounted properly. Even when not snug they still work. They come off easily. I finally decided the best thing to do was once they are properly mounted have slippers when going in to a person's house so you can keep the trax on
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping, good product, thoughtful service
customer_reviews.text: My ice cleats arrived within two days of placing the order. The fit well over my boots are are easy to take on and off. I found them to be very effective on snow and snow-covered ice, somewhat less effective on bare ice. The staff at Limm are extremely pro-active, with thorough follow-up.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Great traction
customer_reviews.text: I use these for walking my dogs when it's super icy outside. I was sick of slipping every few feet and nearly falling. These are great for traction. They work best if not on a cleaned sidewalk just because you can feel the grips through your shoes if they aren't poking into snow or ice. I was skeptical they would work especially since they aren't very expensive but they seem to work great. Hopefully they'll hold up long term. If you're in between sizes, go up. You don't want them too small or they won't fit over your shoes correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Matza

customer_reviews.title: EVERYONE SHOULD HAVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Ohio where you have NO idea what kind of weather you'll get day to day. My mom bought my husband a pair after he slipped on the ice taking out the dog and hurt his wrist really badly. I ended up getting me a pair after we kept fighting over his pair lol. They work really well on iced areas. Easy to put on and take off... and they don't fall off.
customer_reviews.author: shaefus

customer_reviews.title: They keep me upright.
customer_reviews.text: They're good on ice. If you're afraid of falling down and breaking bones you should use them. I find that the size XL go onto my size 10.5 men's shoes and boots and come off quickly when I go into a store that has hard floors. Be sure to take them off in supermarkets and such places because they can be very slippery an such floors. I carry a plastic bag along for that purpose when I remember to.
customer_reviews.author: FranJac

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CLEATS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I normally go through a couple of pair of YakTrax annually - mainly because the rubber parts break. I was a little worried that your largest available size wouldn't fit on my husband's size 12 boots, but they did. We are MAJORLY impressed. We run a horse-farm and the ice has been horrible the past few years. These seem to be much more stable than YakTrax and more sticky, as well. They don't move around as much once they are placed on boots, either. I will definitely be ordering more of these cleats!
customer_reviews.author: Edie

customer_reviews.title: High quality and stable.
customer_reviews.text: The product provides good stability on Ice with numerous sole and heel studs. The square edges on the studs are much better than the rounded version found on the competition. Order larger than you think you need. Due to use on boots, the cleats are really stretched and are sometimes require repositioning. I wear 10.5 to 11 and the 9-12 size barely fit. Otherwise, meets all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Pegs back further please
customer_reviews.text: Great product for ice and snow but feel like the pegs should be further back on the heel of the shoe but super easy to slip on a regular shoe, small to fit in a bag so you can take them off or out them on quick and easily. Looks great as well. Good quality, durable, excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: 1CrazyLife4Me

customer_reviews.title: Made impossible, possible.
customer_reviews.text: This winter these traction cleats have enabled moving snow off my icy driveway possible. These things are really handy. I keep them in my pocket when on dry ground and hook them over shoes when needed. They have been really, really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Ub

customer_reviews.title: They come off easily and you wont even realize until you fall
customer_reviews.text: it's a poor design, they barely go over the edge of the boots. I bought Large for Men's hiking boot size 9. Went on a 8 miles hike with not much elevation. These kept coming off every quarter/half mile, Had to abandon my hike. good thing there were people behind me who picked them up and alerted me, else i would have surely lost them. It happened for both sides. sometimes they came off from the heels and sometimes from the front. so even if they had straps on the front, they would have still come off. just poor design overall.
customer_reviews.author: Desi_Dude

customer_reviews.title: Walk with confidence!
customer_reviews.text: I live in MN and take my dog on 2 walks per day. Had an old pair that literally fell apart while walking and needed a replacement fast. Super fast shipping and off we go! Definitely feel much more confident walking on the ice and my dog no longer thinks his name is "careful'!
customer_reviews.author: Dora634

customer_reviews.title: Seems like my shoe size is just inbetween the L and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works OK. I Ordered the XL as I wear a 10.5 shoe. Fits tight on some and too loose on others. Seems like my shoe size is just inbetween the L and XL.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moses

customer_reviews.title: Must have for dog walking on ice.
customer_reviews.text: Using on size 9 Keene hiking shoes and size L fits perfectly. Tried XL since description said XL was for 8.5 and up. XL did not fit snugly and did not stay in place. They do work great and prevent slipping on over when walking the dogs. We had freezing rain which turned into a sheet of ice and neighbor asked how I was able to walk so normally and I showed her my new cleats. Great investment!!! Better than a brokerage hip...
customer_reviews.author: EJC

customer_reviews.title: They stay on, easy to get on, grip well.
customer_reviews.text: I have used other cleats. I had problems with them, but these are made better and work so easily. These are so easy to slip over my shoes and they work really well. I have been able to use them in 5 inches of snow and they stayed on really well. I recommend them to anyone that wants sure footing in slippery snow or on areas where ice is intermittent. They grip well. They are a really good bargain, when one considers the cost of falling. I feel a lot more confident walking outside in winter with these on.
customer_reviews.author: Louise D.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep me safe
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy "cage" around front of boot. Good, but the part which should be centered on my heel is in front of the heel under my instep. So it doesnt make contact with the ice. I think I ordered the right size, but is isn't working properly. they are good quality but I dont know what I did wrong as it doesn't fit right. perhaps a smaller size?????
customer_reviews.author: linda landis

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised how easy they were to slip onto my boots and even ...
customer_reviews.text: We live in MN and have a very long driveway; when it is trash day, we have to pull the cans down a hill and then up to the street. This year, our gravel driveway has been icy for a month and half. My friend suggested these cleats. She has a pair and she loves them! When I got mine, I was surprised how easy they were to slip onto my boots and even more happy how well they helped with traction! They make a big difference. I don't use them that often, but they were fairly priced, convenient and a product that does what it says it does!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These we love. My girlfriend had a stroke a while back ...
customer_reviews.text: These we love. My girlfriend had a stroke a while back and has a hard time keeping her feet on the pedals when we bike. Traditional methods have not worked. We had these and decided to try them wrapped around her shoes and pedals...they worked grest...so now we get that use and their intended usage (when winter rolls around) as well. Very durable even when using them in unintended ways.
customer_reviews.author: JRH

customer_reviews.title: Product broke with first use
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the correct size for my shoes. One of the rubber straps broke the first time I tried to use them. I am returning for a refund and will look elsewhere for higher quality traction cleats.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer F.

customer_reviews.title: Not for treks maybe yes for snow.
customer_reviews.text: Not that great as expected or as mentioned. Might have given the grip but I think I would’ve been better off without it too. So won’t recommend as necessary for treks unless you’re using it in snow
customer_reviews.author: AmitShenoy

customer_reviews.title: Great light!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has black fur so it's hard to see her at night in the yard, so we turn on the light when letting her out and see it bob around as she walks. We also turn it on for dusk and evening walks so others can see it from a distance. She doesn't need it to see things; it's more for her safety and us keeping track of her.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Put on a different pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: This item works better if you have another pair of shoes to leave them on. Be careful walking in the garage before you go outside. While works in hard snow and ice, it can be a little difficult to get use to. For price, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KLR

customer_reviews.title: Minor broke immediately, but considering other review these might be defective
customer_reviews.text: I just opened this product since it snowed all night and I wanted to go for my morning walk... nope. As I put these on the right side one snapped and broke while the left one is fine. I noticed a little grey I g or white I t if the rubber on the right side but I thought it was just some residue from when they made it but I guess it was something more like brittle rubber or whatever this is made out of. Very disappointed because this product has suck high marks and I REALLY need these :(
customer_reviews.author: ERIC D.

customer_reviews.title: Good traction
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a large should of went with medium. They tend to twist to the side so I walk crooked. I have a similar pair that does that as well so maybe it’s the style. As far as traction they have been great
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: GOOD DEAL FOR GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband and he loves them. He works outdoors and without this product he was at high risk of falling. His job requires him to walk over snow covered and icy sidewalk & driveways. They're a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: SooSoo

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: Have bought a pair of these for myself, and a few pairs for friends. We are all amazed at how effective these are for snow hiking. Routinely go up steeper trails with these and experience 0 issues. Bought them after trying a mountain hike without any traction devices. These are cheap, effective, and work wonderfully. Would highly recommend as a beginner purchase or someone who doesn't want to spend a lot of money on something more advanced.
customer_reviews.author: LsSEA

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great for heavy winter weather conditions
customer_reviews.text: These are ok for light snow and ice but I prefer my other ice cleats as they have much more gripping power. I keep these for very light snow or ice days.
customer_reviews.author: Redstar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love these and they have saved me this week while taking my dog for a walk. I was between sizes (M and L) and ordered up. They seem to fit fine and I haven't had them come off during walks. I love them on my Bogs boots - a perfect fit. Easy to walk in, but best on snow or ice vs. pavement.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Telford

customer_reviews.title: Metal spikes fall off
customer_reviews.text: At first I was excited to find these. They slip onto your shoes easily and really make walking on ice a lot safer. However, after about a week most of the little metal spikes had fallen off making them pretty much useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sean O.

customer_reviews.title: Good Grip on the Ice
customer_reviews.text: Living in the Sierra Nevada mountains often provides some challenging icy conditions. I bought these traction devices for my wife and myself with wonderful results. They are especially helpful when snow blowing our driveway or just walking to the mailbox after a storm. I like the fact that the cleats are not overly sharp (like crampons), but are small studs with great grip on the ice. I highly recommend the Limm Ice Traction Cleats Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Flash

customer_reviews.title: A must have for ice
customer_reviews.text: A must have. I'm in Alaska working and I'm so so glad to have these. I walk in snow and ice almost every day. I fell only twice. And both those times I didn't wear them. I don't remove them from my boots now. And I never fell again.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle2020

customer_reviews.title: Great grip on ice and easy to put on and off
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and good grip. I’m wearing size 43 and used it On my snow boots. It holds on snow and ice very well. Comfortable to walk indoors when getting out of hotel but beware as it can be slippery when walking on marvel or smooth tiled floors. Really happy that I got it.
customer_reviews.author: HKOR

customer_reviews.title: Living in Snow Land
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a gift for my Niece, She lives in north west in snow country, she delivers newspapers in the early morning and need cleats so she didn't slip and fall. She stated the did a great job griping the ice and snow delivery up to the front door of customers, Rated an AAA+++
customer_reviews.author: glenda

customer_reviews.title: Stay Safe!
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to put on my slip on shoe because the rubber can be stretched!! I put the cleat on shoe before i put it on my foot so thats a real plus! It made me feel real safe outside on the snow and ice we live in the mountains and this is a necessity! I will buy more in the future the price is fair!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy M

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I'm from the South. It amazes me that native northerners have this "it will never happen to me" attitude about slipping and falling on ice. These are amazing. They work Even in the iciest slick conditions. They easily slip over your shoes. I even carry them with me everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Myra L Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Limm Ice Cleats - size XL
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 9 men’s shoes. I got the XL size Cleats and they fit well for my shoes and also my pull on rubber boots. I have worn them twice and they do add grip to snow and ice. XL size is definitely not too big. They pull on and fit snugly. They are made of inner tube type rubber. Cleats are metal and evenly distributed. Overall a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: I can do winter walks safely!!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't really sure what to expect with these and am SOOOOO thrilled!!! They went on easily over my shoes and provided incredible stability on ice and packed snow. I severely broke my foot last fall and the prospect of falling again is pretty scary to me, but I can't just hole up all winter, especially with 2 young kids. I'm buying these for everyone I know!!
customer_reviews.author: dlh

customer_reviews.title: Work great. Never came off
customer_reviews.text: Bought specifically to hike a frozen trail in Banff. Work great. Never came off, but did adjust the toe a couple of times as it started to get a little askew. But we’re talking a 3-4 hour hike. I’m 58 and size 10 men’s. Wife is size 8 women’s. Got a small for the wife, and extra large for me. I was wearing dinner hunting boots and wife had Boggs.
customer_reviews.author: Jato

customer_reviews.title: Broke The Second Time Worn
customer_reviews.text: Fit was fine. One cleat broke the second time that I went our in the snow!
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: The picture of the Crampon Traction Cleats shows a strap over the toe. There is no strap over the toe and therefore they fall off a lot. I tied them on with baling twine. They grip the ice nicely but would work much better if they had the strap where shown and would stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Cruickshank

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality for a Small Price
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that these were as nice as they are. They work well and are both sturdy and durable. Inexpensive, but I’ve been using them every day since I received them, and they’ve been an absolute blessing. I’m a large person, and they have held up to my weight well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good ice cleats...they work well.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used these once, but so far very happy with them. I wear a size 9 shoe and the large size fit nicely over my regular shoes and chukka boots without too much effort to get them on and off. They do stretch quite a bit, but I think you would need a larger size to go over any snow boots.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: great Product
customer_reviews.text: Used this past winter to clean my driveway and walk my dog. They worked great and seem to be holding up well. I had the kind with springs before and although they worked very well the springs broke very quickly. These seem to be better.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great traction cleats
customer_reviews.text: These fit snuggly and are made of a thick rubber that I assume will last quite a while. The studs are in the right position under the toe and heel. I like them very much.
customer_reviews.author: Roddy Acon

customer_reviews.title: Keeping me on my feet!
customer_reviews.text: Fit well, work well, have kept me on my feet through this lovely icy and snowy winter! Thank you. Even ordered a second set for my neighbor so he too could stay on his feet through all the ice! They just came -- I bet they will help!
customer_reviews.author: Pam N

customer_reviews.title: Great traction for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used this while hiking in the Rocky Mountains. Worked quite well in the snow and never slipped off the boot. I was able to even drive with them on. Probably won't work so well in smooth ice, but in rough, pock marked ice it seemed to hold well. The only place I didn't have great traction was wet snow on an incline. Otherwise it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Kavi Chatoorgoon

customer_reviews.title: Use with a more pointy toed shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my sister and one for my son. My sister says they are difficult to fit on her regular shoes that have a rounded toe but fit great on her boots that have a pointy toe. She liked how well she was able to walk on the icey driveways and sidewalks. My son has not used them yet but I'm hoping they'll fit his rounded toe shoes ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Handy to Have
customer_reviews.text: I got these because of soreness in my arm. If I slipped and caught myself, it would just worsen the soreness. These are great for making it across the driveway and parking lots. Just remember to take them off in a store. They're not made for tiles!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected
customer_reviews.text: A friend told me she liked this type of product. I purchased this brand due to higher reviews than some of the others that were similar. They are working well, so far, and will hopefully save me from another slip and fall on the ice!
customer_reviews.author: LDudley

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is off. I wear a size 9.5 us woman’s so I ordered large as it says it fits 9.5 - 12.5. These won’t stay on my shoes at all. It actually made it less safe to walk. The bummer is the design seems good and so does the rubber, and the few steps I was able to take with the spikes under my feet felt great. I just wish they fit
customer_reviews.author: Megan's

customer_reviews.title: Alaska Tough
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Medium for a women’s size 9 hiker. This was fantastically easy to fit and work with. Spring breakup is imminent up here. I went out with confidence today on my trail walk. Highly recommending this product. Excellent experience!
customer_reviews.author: Moss Goddess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent traction on smooth ice
customer_reviews.text: I bought the extra large and I am using them on a size 10 boot. They are a nice snug fit on my boots. They may fit a size 11 but definitely nothing larger. I just used them after receiving about 1/4" of freezing rain overnight. Absolutely incredible traction on smooth wet ice. At the price point they are a bargain. I am also sure that if they were used on a dry hard surface they would wear out in no time. Even if I wear out a couple of pairs this winter they are very inexpensive insurance against a serious injury from a fall.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: sized small !
customer_reviews.text: these items WAY TOO small , wifes' boot 8, ordered medium 7-9...can't get on boot, I would suggest ordering size up or look at other brands on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mac

customer_reviews.title: Lasts for a couple of uses
customer_reviews.text: Spikes are not durable. Mine lasted about 2 times of wearing them and then there is no traction left. Use your money and get a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Security
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Well made, durable, easy to put on your shoes or boots & stays on. Have only had small areas of patchy icy areas to try out on so far this season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and lightweight. I wear size 9 shoes and the large size was just right. Haven't had a need for them yet but they look like they would be effective for snow and ice. The cleats are similar to what I have on my waders to grip slippery rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Jim V.

customer_reviews.title: What a difference
customer_reviews.text: Went for our first walk with our new cleats today. What a difference. They really grip, especially on ice. They were very easy to put on at the trail head and it wasn’t a completely different walk from yesterday. We have about 2 inches of snow on glare ice. It was treacherous yesterday but today no problem. You cleats can really dig in. Thank you for your fast delivery, great product and attention to your customers. Jim
customer_reviews.author: Jimg

customer_reviews.title: Needed
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift. Since we don’t have winter yet not sure how they will work. I’m sure they will help the fall risk for the person using them. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Walking on ice. No problem.
customer_reviews.text: These compact beauties have saved me from falls more than once. I'm 81 and do not want to fall as I walk my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Zhabba

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for ice surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift, the person who received them really liked the product, and stated they work well on snow and ice surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Mc

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay on boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these, one in a large and one in an extra-large to take on our trip to Iceland. My husband and I both had trouble with keeping them on our boots. Doesn't do much good on ice when they kept coming off. I would return them, but the return window was closed before we ever left the United States. I would not order them again. They need some kind of strap over the toe area to secure them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy J Evans

customer_reviews.title: Other brands are better
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the different brands of crampons at the same time, each costing about the same price, to compare quality and these are the worst pair of the bunch. I recommend any other brand. However, they do work, so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nygard

customer_reviews.title: Not only great, but well made!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought these months ago. They are fantastic, and have stopped my German shepherd puppy from sliding me across the ice!
customer_reviews.author: Paula B

customer_reviews.title: Don't Let that Ice Bust Your Mule
customer_reviews.text: Worked above arctic circle and kept me from busting my rear on ice. Economical and a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: These work pretty well. The only reason I didnt give them 5 stars is because they can be a little tricky to put on but that being said my snowboots are big. Would buy again. They have saved me on many occasions!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Loftus

product_meta.title: Limm Crampons Ice Traction Cleats - Microspikes Grips Quickly & Easily Over Footwear for Snow and Ice Walk, Hike, Climb, Ice Fishing - Portable - Sizes - M/L/XL
product_meta.description: Why Limm Traction Cleats They are affordable, lightweight, effective, portable, and easy to slip on and off which make them a simple yet efficient solution for reducing the risk of falls during treacherous slippery conditions when walking to work, school, or even to the mailbox. They are great for a variety of winter activities as well. The 10 steel studs offer serious traction which makes them perfect for pedestrians, professionals and the elderly. So, if abrasions and injuries kept you away from winter sports, it is high time to unleash your energy and enjoy the adventurous sports to your heart's content. These high-quality traction cleats will keep you out of the harm’s way. Benefits Portable – Can be rolled up to fit into bags, purses and even pockets. Quickly Mountable – Can be slipped over footwear in seconds. Functional Design – Each one is equipped with 10 tough steel spikes in a TPE base to offer a comfortable and safe walk. Fit around the shoe perfectly. Multipurpose Traction – Perfect for everyday use, outdoor winter work or a variety of winter activities such as ice fishing, hunting, walking, jogging, hiking, running, snow shoveling, etc. High Quality Material – Finest quality TPE material is used in the manufacturing process to ensure durability, strength and high quality. Available in four sizes: Small: fits shoe size W4-6, M1-3 Medium: fits shoe size W5.5-9, M3.5-6.5 Large: fits shoe size W8.5-11, M6.5-8.5 Extra Large: fits shoe size W11-12, M8.5-13 *For oversized shoes or boots, we recommend purchasing one size larger than your normal shoe size. The manufacturer, Limm, offers a Lifetime Guarantee. If you do not love it for any reason, simply contact the manufacturer for a complete no-hassle refund. Add your Limm Ice Traction Cleats now!
feature_bullets: Never slip on snow or ice again with your abrasion-resistant crampons. Avoid any injury or pain when walking in different terrains with full sole coverage. Perfect for hiking, fishing, walking, mountaineering, or walking no matter what winter condition to

Full foot anti-slip protection with 10 steel metal studs. These steel micro crampons are placed on heel and forefoot to maintain firm footing on ice or snow. Ideal for snow shovelling, casual walking and daily commuting

Easily slip-on around your footwear in seconds. Just pull the tab over your heel for a snug fit on your shoes, hiking boots, or fishing boots.Rubber top membrane is made of non-tear and non-snap TPE elastic rubber that can withstand and remain flexible in
Cleats roll up nicely to be carried in a purse, work-bag or even in your pocket. Lightweight and durable materials used and easy to put into a carry pouch or a bag
Available in a variety of sizes for men, women and kids. Great for winter activities or even simple everyday use to help prevent slipping, tripping or falling on snow or ice
